{{also|drucken|Drücken|Drucken}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*þrukjaną||to press}}, {{m|gem-pro|*þrūganą||to threaten}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*trūk-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*trūg-||to press, beat}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|drukken||to press, print}}, {{cog|da|trykke||to press}}, {{cog|en|thrutch||to throng}}. Closely cognate with {{cog|de|drucken||to print}}: ''drucken'' was originally the southern form, ''drücken'' was historically North German. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈdʁʏkŋ̩]|[ˈdʁʏkən]}} * {{audio|de|De-drücken.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-drücken.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|drückt|drückte|gedrückt}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[press]]; to [[push]] (e.g., a door handle) # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[hug]] (somebody) # {{lb|de|intransitive|reflexive}} to [[shirk]] ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|drück|gedrückt|h}} ====Antonyms==== * {{sense|to pull}} {{l|de|ziehen}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|abdrücken}} * {{l|de|ausdrücken}} * {{l|de|draufdrücken}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|Drückeberger}} * {{l|de|knuddeln|pos=v}} * {{l|de|umarmen|pos=v}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
